intro: Duvalia maculata, commonly known as the spotted duvalia, is a species of flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its attractive, showy flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and prefers full sun to partial shade. Its leaves are opposite and often have a distinctive spotted or mottled appearance. Duvalia maculata is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and landscapes.
